intro: Echium sericeum subsp. halacsyi, commonly known as the silky thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy leaves and tall spikes of blue to violet flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or coastal areas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies halacsyi is distinguished by its more compact growth and slightly different leaf morphology compared to the typical E. sericeum.
